intro: Physaria macrocarpa, commonly known as the large-seeded bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cress plants. The plant is characterized by its erect, branched stems and yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. Its distinctive feature is the presence of inflated, bladder-like fruits that contain the seeds. Physaria macrocarpa is often found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
